title: Print, "Ceiling design, evoking fire and sun", 1740
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
Upper left (presumed central ceiling motif) a large symmetrical design with central medallion oval, delicate frame consisting of acathus leaves, small leaves, arabesques and C scrolles. Below, at right angle, two cartouches with scenes, a fire-breathing dragon, a boy holding a standard, a corner cartouche with scene of four small boys playing a game, a large image of helos flanked by fantastical fire-breathing dragons. Sections are connected by dotted lines, presumably as a guide for the stuccodor.

Inscriptions: 
Cum Privil. S.C. Maj.
F. de Cuvilliés In. etdel.
F. X. Jungwierth. SC. Mon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Ceiling design, evoking fire and sun", 1740.
1740. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-282-14.
